issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.summary: [Format][C++] Support multiple frames in LZ4 for IPC buffer compression?

comments.body:
Hmm, I think we should make the spec more precise about this.

Normally, you don't need to emit multiple frames to support streaming compression. At least the LZ4 C API allows streaming compression inside a single frame. Also, emitting multiple frames is probably worse for compression efficiency (because "Each frame is considered independent" as per the [LZ4 spec|https://github.com/lz4/lz4/blob/dev/doc/lz4_Frame_format.md#general-structure-of-lz4-frame-format]).
I do find a bit odd to restrict which LZ4 we support, but writing "LZ4 MUST be written in a single frame" in the spec is another option, yes.
Well, it doesn't seem to be useful on the emitting side and it makes the receiving side more complex.
